title: Middle Eastern Food Terms
description: Discover the rich vocabulary of Middle Eastern cuisine, from hummus to shawarma

questions.question: In Middle Eastern cuisine, what is 'shawarma'?
options: Seasoned meat stacked on a vertical spit, slow-roasted and shaved off to serve

questions.question: What is 'falafel' made from?
options: Ground chickpeas or fava beans formed into balls or patties and deep-fried

questions.question: What does 'tahini' refer to in Middle Eastern cooking?
options: A paste made from ground sesame seeds

questions.question: In Middle Eastern cuisine, what is 'fattoush'?
options: A salad featuring toasted or fried pieces of pita bread with mixed greens and vegetables

questions.question: What is 'labneh' in Middle Eastern food?
options: Strained yogurt with a thick, creamy consistency used as a spread or dip

questions.question: What does 'za'atar' refer to in Middle Eastern cuisine?
options: A blend of dried herbs, sesame seeds, and sumac used as a seasoning

questions.question: In Middle Eastern food, what is 'baba ganoush'?
options: A smoky dip made from roasted eggplant blended with tahini, garlic, and lemon

questions.question: What is 'sumac' in Middle Eastern cooking?
options: A deep red spice ground from dried berries with a tangy, lemony flavor

questions.question: What does 'kibbeh' refer to in Middle Eastern cuisine?
options: A dish of ground meat mixed with bulgur wheat, often formed into croquettes

questions.question: In Middle Eastern food, what is 'manakish' (or 'manoushe')?
options: A flatbread typically topped with za'atar and olive oil, often eaten for breakfast

questions.question: What is 'halloumi' in Middle Eastern cuisine?
options: A semi-hard, unripened cheese with a high melting point, ideal for grilling

questions.question: What does 'tabbouleh' primarily consist of?
options: Finely chopped parsley, tomatoes, mint, bulgur wheat, and lemon-olive oil dressing

questions.question: In Middle Eastern cuisine, what is 'harissa'?
options: A fiery North African chili paste made from roasted peppers, spices, and olive oil

questions.question: What is 'knafeh' (or 'kunafa') in Middle Eastern food?
options: A sweet dessert made with shredded phyllo or semolina dough, cheese, and sweet syrup
